steps.name: Home and living
steps.intro:
In this section we will ask you questions about how you manage at home.

Important advice for completing this section:
- Choose the option(s) that best describes your situation.
- Base your answers on a typical week (if you have one).
- When answering the questions, don't think about any support you have at the moment; imagine yourself alone in your home with nobody else there to help you.

fields.question: I am able to clean and maintain my home on my own and without help not causing significant pain, distress or anxiety, or endangering myself or others and not taking significantly longer than would normally be expected.
fields.id: I am able to clean and maintain my home

steps.name: Your finances
steps.intro:
Unlike services provided by the NHS, most adult social care services are not free of charge

This means that when Hackney Council helps you to arrange your care and support services, you will have a financial assessment to work out how much you have to pay towards the cost of your services. This is worked out using your income, benefits and any capital or savings that you have.

Once an assessment of your care needs is completed, if you are eligible you will need to complete a full financial assessment to establish your weekly charge / contribution.

The questions below are not mandatory but completing the questions will give you an indication as to whether you are likely to have to pay for some or all of any care and support you may need.

steps.name: Contingency plan
steps.intro:
An emergency 'what if?' plan is a record of what would need to happen, should you unexpectedly not be able to provide the care you usually do.

A What If Plan more than anything is peace of mind.  It is a way of having all the most important information, key contacts, needs and likes of the person you care for recorded in one place and easily accessible should you ever be unable to be there as you usually would.
